result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin R Zigan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain/obtain full time employment and/or school.

Court finds that if the Defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the Defendant's interest to have this expunged and society will not be harmed and grant expunction.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Trees on the Move, Home City Ice, Cory A., or Kevin M.

timeConds.notes: To be completed during Probation - as a condition.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: on petition to expunge court record of conviction.  Request denied and order signed by Judge Aprahamian on 12/29/16.

Defendant Austin R Zigan in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court calls the review the petition for expungement.  The Defendant has obtained new law violations and the Court denies the request for expungement for reasons stated on the record.
From Atty Kent dated 9/27/16 informing Court that he has not been retained and, accordingly, will not be appearing on defendant's behalf.
From Atty Kent dated 9/23/16 requesting expunction with attached supporting documentation.
Review hearing on September 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Certificate of Discharge and Satisfaction of Probation Conditions for Expungement. 
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 7/12/16; schedule hearing to address expunction.

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Discharge date: 06/09/16
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Letter from The Boat House, Jackie Z. and Daryl Z. filed by Defense
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Austin R Zigan in court with attorney Mark A. Kent.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 5 months jail straight time STAYED for one year Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution has been paid
- DNA Surcharge is waived.
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.   No contact with Trees on the Move, Home City Ice or Cory A. or Kevin M..    
- Defendant to perform 75 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation.
 

Defense requests expunction. 
State takes no position on expunction. 
If the defendant successfully completes Probation and has no new law violations, Court finds it is in the interest to grant expunction to the defendant and society will not be harmed.
